Dear Dr. Goodwin, Mr Johnson and group,

I want to model ethanol hydrogasification using Cantera. I am facing 
a problem because the GRI MECH 3.0 database does not include ethanol. 
I am a new user of Cantera and hence need some guidance from you. It 
would be of great help if you can give me some reference to related 
codes. 
Regards,
Gagan

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, David Goodwin <dgoodwin@c...> wrote:
> Michael,
> 
> Cantera flags some reactions as duplicatess that Chemkin does not.  
All 
> you have to do is tell Cantera that you intend this by adding:
> 
> options = "duplicate"
> 
> for each reaction it flags as an undeclared duplicate, for example:
> 
> falloff_reaction( "h + o2 (+ M) <=> ho2 (+ M)"
>           kf = [4.52000E+013, 0, 0],
>           kf0   = [1.05000E+019, -1.257, 0],
>           efficiencies = " ch4:10  co:1.9  co2:3.8  h2:0  h2o:0  
n2:0 ",
>           options = "duplicate")
> 
> This is done intentionallly, since a reaction like h + o2 (+ n2) 
<=> 
> ho2 (+ n2) could also be written as h + o2 (+ M) <=> ho2 (+ M) with 
all 
> efficiencies set to zero except the one for n2.
> Also, if you have two reactions
>   A + B <=> C + D
> and
> C + D <=> A + B
> Cantera says these are duplicates, but Chemkin does not.
> Cantera performs some other checks too, such as whether NASA 
polynomial 
> thermo parameterizations are continuous at the midpoint 
temperature, 
> etc.
> 
> These extra checks can help find error in reaction mechanisms that 
> might otherwise go unnoticed, which is especially a problem with 
very 
> large mechanisms.
> 
> Dave
> 
> 
> On Aug 6, 2004, at 9:15 AM, Michael Johnson wrote:
> 
> > Dear Dave and group,
> >
> > I am trying to use the ethanol mechanism of Marinov, available at:
> > www-cms.llnl.gov/combustion/combustion2.html
> >
> > ck2cti converts it to cti format with no problem, but there are 
> > three-body
> > falloff reactions that have different low-pressure coefficients 
for
> > different third bodies and Cantera has problems with that.
> >
> > The reactions are:
> >
> > #  Reaction 4
> > falloff_reaction( "h + o2 (+ M) <=> ho2 (+ M)",
> >          kf = [4.52000E+013, 0, 0],
> >          kf0   = [1.05000E+019, -1.257, 0],
> >          efficiencies = " ch4:10  co:1.9  co2:3.8  h2:0  h2o:0  
n2:0 ")
> >
> > #  Reaction 5
> > falloff_reaction( "h + o2 (+ n2) <=> ho2 (+ n2)",
> >          kf = [4.52000E+013, 0, 0],
> >          kf0   = [2.03000E+020, -1.59, 0])
> >
> > (and two others with n2 and h2o as third bodies)
> >
> > The error I get with Cantera is:
> >
> > Procedure: installReaction
> > Error:   Undeclared duplicate reactions detected:
> > Reaction 4: h + o2 (+ M) <=> ho2 (+ M)
> > Reaction 5: h + o2 (+ n2) <=> ho2 (+ n2)
> >
> > What can be done in this situation?
> >
> > Thanks,
> > Michael
> >
> >
